intro: Esula dalechampii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its stems are woody and branched. Esula dalechampii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
